revised_title: Anatomy and Physiology of the Ornithorhynchus Hystrix
tldr: The author provides a detailed description of the external and internal anatomy of the Ornithorhynchus Hystrix, a marsupial native to New South Wales. The article highlights the unique features of this animal, such as its bill, teeth, and digestive system, and compares them to those of the Ornithorhynchus paradoxus. The author also discusses the differences in the management of food and the sense of touch in the two species.
